description: From Middle English notschelle, from Old English hnutsċiell. Equivalent to nut +‎ shell.

entries.meaning: The shell that surrounds the kernel of a nut.
examples: For men be now tratlers and tellers of tales;What tidings at Totnam, what newis in Wales,What ſhippis are ſailing to Scalis Malis?And all is not worth a couple of nut ſhalis.

entries.meaning: A short book summarizing an area of law.
(nautical) A small boat; a boat considered small in comparison to the seas.

verbs.description: nutshell (third-person singular simple present nutshells, present participle nutshelling, simple past and past participle nutshelled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To summarize (from the term in a nutshell).
